column4: Hi everyone, i just got a quick question, i just updated ubuntu 8.04 and everything works as expected all i am wonderin is how can i redirect  the "documents music, picutres, videos, and the desktop" to a network share folder. i know in windows you right click then and choose redirect and then the address but how can you do it in ubuntu? thank you very much in advance (^ ^)v
cd ~; rm Documents; ln -s /path/to/network/documents Documents
could u explain the rm Documents once again this irc goes too fast please
what are you trying to do?
i am trying to redirect the documents and desktop into a share folder located in a windows server 2008
why those subfolder? in particular why desktop?
so that way the server can back up those files
you don't want to mount the whole home directory remotely?
well it's cuz i dont want ppl here to get confused and start saving in their computers instead of in the redirected folder. i also need to  mount the whole drive too cuz we use a public folder
perhaps you should just mount the whole /home remotely
how can i do it? cuz everytime i mount it next time i log in it is gone xD
not sure but there's gotta be lots of info on doing that in Linux out there
yes cuz when i tried doing it as a shortcut it will give me an error message =/
links only work locally.. you need to do it in /etc/fstab, and obviously the network share would have to be connected to earlier in the boot process
also you would want that share to support Linux file permissions, so that means no samba
but NFS instead
maybe you just want to use a backup script instead? ;)
backup script?
yes, backup instead of mounting the filesystem remotely
how?
thank you ^ ^
just before i leave, there is no way that ubuntu can read a user profile of windows server correct?
if you share it in windows you can access the files
alrite thanks you so much for all your help ^_^
